definition: Paul (name)
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
variant of 爾|尔[er3]
thus/so/like that/you/thou
Paulson or Powellson (name)/Henry (Hank) Paulson (1946-), US banker, US Treasury Secretary from 2006

sentences.english: But Mr. Paulson insists that he wants a “clean” plan.
sentences.chinese: 但是保尔森先生坚持他想要一个“干净”的方案。

sentences.english: Paul was badly injured when his car was in head-on collision with a bus.
sentences.chinese: 保尔的汽车同一辆公共汽车迎头相撞时，受了重伤。

sentences.english: Poulter recalls the sense of being on the outside looking in.
sentences.chinese: 保尔特回忆起他在外观赛的感受。

sentences.english: V. S. Naipaul is an important modern writer of post-colonial literature.
sentences.chinese: 奈保尔是当代后殖民文学的重要作家。

sentences.english: Paul chips approach shot onto green and close to flag.
sentences.chinese: 保尔近穴击球，球落在了果岭靠近旗杆处。

sentences.english: People in backstreet will remind us of the characters in Naipaul's novel "Miguel Street".
sentences.chinese: 后街的一切让人想起奈保尔《米格尔街》中的人物。

sentences.english: Going into the weekend, Paulson made a three-part gamble.
sentences.chinese: 到周末时，保尔森进行了一个由三部分组成的赌博。

sentences.english: In a fishing, Paul made forestry official daughter dounia.
sentences.chinese: 在一次钓鱼的时候，保尔结识了林务官的女儿冬妮娅。

sentences.english: She had so loved Pavel Korchagin, a son of impoverished family.
sentences.chinese: 她曾经那样地热爱穷人的儿子保尔。
现在，奈保尔有了他丰碑式的正传。

sentences.english: These were the investments Paulson wanted included in a new DDO.
sentences.chinese: 保尔森希望把这些投资纳入一款新DDO。

sentences.english: Paul and Rachel are blameless tourists.
sentences.chinese: 瑞秋和保尔都是无辜的旅游者。

sentences.english: The Treasury secretary says he hopes for congressional approval next week.
sentences.chinese: 保尔森说，他希望下星期能获得国会的批准。

sentences.english: Paulson supports the principle-based approach, to a degree.
sentences.chinese: 在某种程度上，保尔森支持采用原则性监管体制。

definition: Nikolai Ostrovsky (1904-1936), Soviet socialist realist writer/Alexander Ostrovsky (1823-1886), Russian playwright
pinyin: Ao4 si1 te4 luo4 fu1 si1 ji1

definition: Tolstoy (name)/Count Lev Nikolayevich Tostoy (1828-1910), great Russian novelist, author of War and Peace 戰爭與和平|战争与和平
Hugo (name)/Victor Hugo (1802-1885), French writer
Honoré de Balzac (1799-1850), French novelist, author of series La comédie humaine
Helen Keller (1880-1968), famous American deaf-blind author and activist (whose story is told in biopic The Miracle Worker)
Vladimir Ilyich Lenin (1870-1924), Russian revolutionary leader
Ernest Hemingway (1899-1961), American novelist and journalist
Alexandr Solzhenitsyn (1918-2008), Russian writer, prominent Soviet dissident, author of the Gulag Archipelago
Christopher (name)
Fyodor Mikhailovich Dostoevsky (1821-1881), great Russian novelist, author of Crime and Punishment 罪與罰|罪与罚[Zui4 yu3 Fa2]
pinyin: Tuo2 si1 tuo3 ye1 fu1 si1 ji1

definition: Jean-Paul Sartre (1905-1980), French existential philosopher and novelist
Alexandre Dumas, père (1802-1870), French writer
Ivan Sergeevich Turgenev (1818-1883), Russian novelist
Jack London (1876-1916), American writer
William Faulkner (1897-1962), American novelist and poet
Marx (name)
